column4: Johnson & Johnson sues Glaxo over allergy ads as spring nears
column5: NEW YORK Johnson & Johnson sued rival drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline PLC on Thursday  alleging that Glaxo is trying to unlawfully grab market share with false advertising at the start of spring allergy season in the United States.

column4: Johnson & Johnson sues Glaxo over allergy ads as spring nears
column5: NEW YORK Johnson & Johnson sued rival drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline PLC on Thursday  alleging that Glaxo is trying to unlawfully grab market share with false advertising at the start of spring allergy season in the United States.

column5: NEW YORK  March 12 Johnson & Johnson  sued rival drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline PLC on Thursday  alleging that Glaxo is trying to unlawfully grab market share with false advertising at the start of spring allergy season in the United States.

column4: UPDATE 6-TSB shares soar as Spain's Sabadell proposes $2.6 billion bid

column4: Spain's Sabadell considers 1.5 bln euros share issue -source
column5: MADRID  March 12 Spain's Sabadell is considering a 1.5 billion euros  ($1.6 billion) capital hike via a share issue to fund a possible bid for British bank TSB   a banking source with knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.

column4: TSB leads rise in UK stocks as Sabadell makes takeover bid
column5: LONDON  March 12 UK shares rose on Thursday  led by domestic bank TSB after it received a takeover offer  and by drugs group AstraZeneca on optimism about key trial results.

column4: Hedge funds face losses after TSB shares soar on Sabadell bid
column5: LONDON  March 12 Hedge funds that took "short" positions betting on a drop in British bank TSB face possible losses as the stock surged more than 20 percent after a takeover bid from Spain's Banco Sabadell on Thursday.

column4: TSB shares soar as Spain's Sabadell proposes $2.6 billion bid
column5: LONDON/MADRID British challenger bank TSB  has received a takeover approach from Banco Sabadell   valuing the business at about $2.6 billion and sending its shares soaring by nearly a quarter.

column4: TSB leads rise in UK stocks as Sabadell makes takeover bid

column5: LONDON  March 12 UK shares rose on Thursday as a rebound in commodity prices boosted mining and energy stocks and domestic bank TSB surged on the back of a takeover offer.

column4: Lumber Liquidators defends floor product safety  offers free tests
column5: Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc  defended its flooring against allegations that some of its products contain dangerous levels of a cancer-causing substance  delivering a blow-by-blow account of its testing process to assuage investor concerns.

column4: UPDATE 3-Lumber Liquidators defends floor product safety  offers free tests
column5: * Shares rise as much as 15.4 percent   (Adds details from conference call  updates shares)

column4: Tilson says Lumber Liquidators' call 'campaign of distraction and deception'
column5: NEW YORK Kase Capital Managing Director Whitney Tilson  who is short Lumber Liquidator shares  said on Thursday that Lumber Liquidators' conference call was "a continuation of the company's campaign of distraction and deception."

column4: Tilson says Lumber Liquidators' call 'campaign of distraction and deception'
column5: NEW YORK  March 12 Kase Capital Managing Director Whitney Tilson  who is short Lumber Liquidator  shares  said on Thursday that Lumber Liquidators' conference call was "a continuation of the company's campaign of distraction and deception."

column4: Lumber Liquidators stands by safety of products  offers free tests
column5: March 12 Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc  which is facing U.S. government probes over claims of dangerous levels of a cancer-causing substance in its flooring products  stood by the safety its products and said it would offer free indoor air quality testing for qualifying consumers.

column4: KFC faces pressure after McDonald's says no antibiotics in chicken
column5: LOS ANGELES/CHICAGO KFC  the world's largest chain of fried chicken restaurants  may face pressure from consumer and environmental groups to change how its poultry are raised after McDonald's Corp said it would switch to chicken raised without human antibiotics. | Video

column4: RPT - INSIGHT-KFC faces pressure after McDonald's says no antibiotics in chicken
column5: LOS ANGELES/CHICAGO  March 12 KFC  the world's largest chain of fried chicken restaurants  may face pressure from consumer and environmental groups to change how its poultry are raised after McDonald's Corp said it would switch to chicken raised without human antibiotics.

column4: UPDATE 2-Brazil steelmaker CSN hopes strong dollar will double U.S. sales
column5: SAO PAULO  March 12 Brazilian steelmaker Cia Siderurgica Nacional SA expects to double its sales on the U.S. market in 2015 to 600 000 tonnes with the help of a stronger dollar  the company's head of sales said on Thursday.

column4: Brazil steelmaker CSN sees opportunity in US with strong dollar
column5: SAO PAULO  March 12 Brazilian steelmaker Cia Siderurgica Nacional SA expects to double steel sales on the U.S. market to 600 000 tonnes as the strong dollar is expected to boost profits there  the company's director of sales said.

column4: Dutch pay-per-story start-up Blendle signs U.S. newspapers
column5: FRANKFURT Dutch pay-per-story start-up Blendle has signed deals with the Wall Street Journal  New York Times and  Washington Post  marking its first offering of English language newspapers on its service  the company said in Thursday.

column4: Orbital ATK to finish rocket explosion probe by end March: CEO
column5: WASHINGTON Orbital ATK expects to complete an investigation into the Oct. 28 explosion of its Antares rocket by the end of March  the company's chief executive said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Orbital ATK to finish rocket explosion probe by end March -CEO
column5: WASHINGTON  March 12 Orbital ATK expects to complete an investigation into the Oct. 28 explosion of its Antares rocket by the end of March  the company's chief executive said on Thursday.

column4: Venezuela likely to seek annulment in $455 mln Owens-Illinois award-lawyer
column5: CARACAS  March 12 Venezuela is likely to seek the annulment of a World Bank tribunal award that orders it pay U.S. bottle maker Owens-Illinois $455 million in compensation for nationalization  a lawyer for the South American country said on Thursday.

column4: Endo's bid for Salix shows its strategy as Valeant challenger
column5: Endo International Plc's  $11 billion offer this week for Salix Pharmaceuticals Ltd   an effort to trump an agreed $10 billion bid from Valeant Pharmaceutical Inc   illustrates CEO Rajiv De Silva's plan to be seen as not just a protege of Valeant chief Mike Pearson  but as a challenger.

column4: Former CEO of Brazil's Petrobras says no way to discover wrongdoing
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO The former head of Petrobras  said on Thursday there was no way the state-run oil company could have discovered the massive corruption scheme that is adding to Brazil's economic and political troubles.

column4: Former CEO of Brazil's Petrobras says no way to discover wrongdoing
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  March 12 The former head of Petrobras said on Thursday there was no way the state-run oil company could have discovered the massive corruption scheme that is adding to Brazil's economic and political troubles.

column4: Pfizer hunts for new vaccines to protect young and old
column5: LONDON Pfizer is seeking new vaccine opportunities across the age spectrum as it broadens its portfolio by delivering shots into the arms of adolescents and the elderly  as well as infants.

column4: New Credit Suisse boss faces stiff challenge in Asia
column5: HONG KONG/LONDON Incoming Credit Suisse boss Tidjane Thiam is expected to focus on private banking in Asia while aggressively cutting jobs at its investment bank  as he aims to repeat the success in the region of his old employer  Prudential.

column4: Zimbabwe says to merge all diamond mines under one company
column5: HARARE Zimbabwe is planning to merge all diamond mining companies  including the local unit of Rio Tinto  into one big firm in which the state will own half of the shares  the minister of mines said on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Blackstone-controlled cement maker Summit Materials rises 12.5 pct in debut
column5: March 12 Shares of cement maker Summit Materials Inc  controlled by Blackstone Group LP  rose as much as 12.5 percent in their trading debut on Thursday  valuing the company at $1.87 billion.

column4: Blackstone-controlled cement maker Summit Materials rises 12.5 pct in debut
column5: March 12 Shares of Summit Materials Inc  a cement maker controlled by Blackstone Group LP  rose as much as 12.5 percent in their trading debut on Thursday  valuing the company at $1.87 billion.

column4: Takeover of UTC's Sikorsky helicopter unit seen less likely  for now
column5: March 12 United Technologies Corp's  Sikorsky helicopter unit could be acquired by another big defense company  but the potential for a big tax bill means the maker of Black Hawk helicopters will more likely be spun off into a standalone company  analysts said.

column4: UTC to weigh splitting off of Sikorsky helicopter unit
column5: United Technologies Corp  will explore spinning off its Sikorsky helicopter unit  in the first major move by the company's new chief executive officer to overhaul the U.S. conglomerate's portfolio of businesses.

column4: Volkswagen makes slow progress in cutting costs
column5: BERLIN Volkswagen  is making slow progress in cutting costs at its core passenger car brand  where profit continued to fall last year due to weaker emerging markets and technology costs.

column4: Highly pathogenic bird flu confirmed in Arkansas turkeys: USDA
column5: CHICAGO The U.S. Department of Agriculture on Wednesday confirmed the discovery of highly pathogenic avian influenza in a commercial turkey flock in Arkansas  the third-largest U.S. turkey producer and home to Tyson Foods Inc  the nation's biggest chicken company.
